thread.title: Middle school pitch play winds down, playoffs kick in soon
thread.title_full: Middle school pitch play winds down, playoffs kick in soon

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Middle school pitch play winds down, playoffs kick in soon
text:
Middle school pitch play winds down, playoffs kick in soon By Staff | Oct 08, 2015 Photo by: Mark Haskell Appleton's Hugh Costigan, left, as well as St. George's Leah Cushman, kicking ball, and Jackson Fitch, middle, during a Busline League middle school coed soccer game Oct. 5. Host Appleton won 6-2. View More... 
The Busline League middle school boys, girls and coed soccer regular seasons are nearly complete, with squads looking to turn its focus to the postseason. 
The coed campaign wrapped up on Wednesday, Oct. 7, while the boys and girls seasons officially will end on Friday, Oct 9. 
The playoffs are slated to begin on Tuesday, Oct. 13, with the championship finals to be at Point Lookout in Northport. 
The coed final will be held on Thursday, Oct. 22, the girls final on Monday, Oct. 26 and the boys final on Tuesday, Oct. 27. Each game will begin at 3:30 p.m. 
The final regular-season standings and playoff pairings for soccer will appear later with this story. 
Information included in this story is provided by schools/coaches and may not be complete for all teams involved. 
The following is a recap of recently-reported results: 
Coed Soccer 
Hope 5, St. George 0 
At Hope Oct. 7, the Hawks soared past the Dragons and prevailed by five goals. 
Adam Thorndike finished with a hat trick for Hope, while Owen Power and Noah Quesnel had one goal. 
Lincolnville 9, Nobleboro 1 
At Nobleboro Oct. 7, The Lions scored first, but it was the Lynx who scored often as they surged to an eight-goal win. Lincolnville held a 6-1 advantage at halftime. 
Leading the Lynx offense were Kasey Wood (2 goals), Jack Fishman (2 assists), Eric Andrews (goal), Sam Luft (2 goals), Joey Lachance (assist), Kris Kelly (goal), Mike Kremin (goal), Hope Osgood (goal) and Rowan Hurlburt (goal). 
Trailing 1-0 early, the Lynx jump-started their offense as Wood scored, off an assist from Fishman, who minutes later fed Luft on the first of his two scores as the visitors took the lead. 
Andrews creased the net on an unassisted score, while a minute later Luft scored again, this time from Lachance. 
Kelly and Wood wrapped the first-half scoring, while Kremin, Osgood and Hurlburt added to Lincolnville's lead in the second half. 
Appleton 6, St. George 2 
At Appleton Oct. 5, the Wildcats tamed the Dragons, prevailing by three scores. 
Leading the Appleton offense were Ben Owre (2 goals), Grady Richman (goal, assist), Gus Vietze (goal, 2 assists), Jackson Bernier (goal), Levi Guay (goal) and Myles Kelley (assist). 
Obie Miller and Logan Putansu creased the net for St. George. 
Hope 14, Nobleboro 0 
At Nobleboro Oct. 5, the Hawks soared past the Lions by double-digits. 
Adam Thorndike, Taylor Wesbrock and Owen Porter had hat tricks on the day, while Ella Pierce added two goals and Kieran McGrath, Sylvan Eichenlaub and Frances Ostensen one. 
Lincolnville 3, Jefferson 0 
At Lincolnville Oct. 5, the Lynx blanked the Chargers by three scores. Lincolnville led 1-0 at halftime. 
Kris Kelly scored two goals to pace Lincolnville, while Owen Markotitz also creased the net in the win. 
Lynx coach Ben Edes said "Lulu Lydon, Kasey Wood, Wyatt Munson and Hope Osgood played a fine game to help keeper Matt Kremin preserve the shutout,” while “Sam Luft and Eric Andrews did an excellent job working with both offense and defense to control the game.” 
Lincolnville 4, South Bristol 0 
At Lincolnville Oct. 2, the Lynx blanked the visiting Blue Devils. Lincolnville led 2-0 at halftime. 
Kris Kelly, Hayden Thibeault and Owen Markowitz scored for Lincolnville, while the fourth Lynx goal was an own-goal. 
Kelly gave the Lynx a 1-0 lead more than halfway through the first half, while Thibeault creased the net next, thanks, in part, to a pair of crisp passes by Sam Luft and Jack Fishman. 
Markowitz added a third score one minute in the second half before the hosts benefited from an ow- goal when a South Bristol defender inadvertently kicked the ball into the team's own net. 
Boys soccer 
Camden-Rockport 2, Oceanside 1 
At Thomaston Oct. 5, the Schooners sailed to a one-goal win over the Mariners. The squads were tied 1-1 at halftime. 
Zephyr Bombeke and Danila Borodaenko scored goals for Camden-Rockport, while Quinn Brown added an assist. 
Andrew Orne and Sam Conlan split time in net for the Schooners.
